title: Warm up hips before every swing
body: 90/90s and thoracic rotations prep mobility so your backswing stays smooth and pain-free.

title: Brace before impact
body: Think ribs down and glutes on. This keeps the spine stable through contact and improves consistency.

title: Own your tempo
body: Slow drills first, then speed. Groove the pattern before adding load or velocity.

title: Train rotation in planes
body: Cable chops, med-ball throws, and anti-rotation holds build power you can actually use.

title: Recover like it matters
body: Sleep, hydration, and light mobility work extend progress and reduce overuse flare-ups.

title: Progress one variable
body: Add volume, load, or intensityâ€”just one at a time to avoid overload and keep gains steady.
